meta_description:
Clewiston Museum
Discover History, Art, and Culture of the Hendry Glades area of South Florida.
hours_text:
Hours:

Monday - Friday: 9:00 am - 4:00 pm

Saturdays by appointment only (requires 48 hours advance notice; based on availability): call 863-983-2870 or email us: [director@clewistonmuseum.org](mailto:clewistonmuseum@embarqmail.com?subject=Schedule%20a%20Museum%20Visit)[. ](mailto:clewistonmuseum@embarqmail.com?subject=Schedule%20a%20Museum%20Visit)

Sundays - Closed 

# Visit Us!  
The Clewiston Museum is located at 109 Central Avenue, Clewiston, FL  

# Admission:  
Purchase in advance or at the museum:  
Adults: $10.00  
Seniors (age 50+): $8.00  
Children/Students: $5.00  
Groups (8 people or more): $5.00 each (call 863-983-2870)  
Present your confirmation email as your ticket for admission.

admission_text:
# Acerca de

## North American Reciprocal Museums

The Clewiston Museum is a member of the North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) program, which provides a NARM family membership to Clewiston Museum members who join at $100 or above,

​

NARM reciprocal benefits include* free/members admission price, discounts in the shop, and discounts on ticketed events at all NARM member organizations! Please note that ‘Family’ benefits are specific to each institution (e.g. If you visit an institution that has ‘Family’ benefits defined as two adults and two children then those are the ‘Family’ benefits you will receive when you visit with a ‘Family’ membership).

​

Be sure to contact the institutions you plan to visit in advance if you have questions about your specific reciprocal benefits.

​

*If there is a notation by the institution name (e.g. **), some restrictions may apply.

Check out this list of participating institutions [here.](https://narmassociation.org/members/)

​

​

Operating Hours

Mon - Fri: 9am - 4pm

​​Saturday: By Appointment Only

Sunday: Closed

collections_text:
## "The history of Clewiston is as rich as the soil she sets on. As vast as the big lake she stands beside." 

### Mueum After Hours Program: Gary McKechnie and "What in the World? How Walt Created Disney World

## Thursday, January 8, 2026  
Museum Opens: 6:00 PM  
Program: 7:00 PM  
FREE

When Walt Disney realized cheap tourist traps were enveloping Disneyland, he began a nationwide search for enough land to hold every dream he could imagine. What happened next would require a heightened degree of CIA-level secrecy for Disney’s undercover team, who launched a misinformation campaign that included dummy corporations and secret transactions. However, when a keen-eyed reporter cracked the code, Disney was forced to show his hand.
